item.title: Delta Force Devs Caught Stealing Rust Assets For New Trailer
item.content:encoded:
In a post on social media, Rust’s COO, Alistair McFarlane, called out Delta Force’s development team for stealing assets from his game. In a new trailer that surfaced to promote an event in Delta Force, developed by TiMi Studio Group, an explosive asset was seen front and centre.

This was revealed by McFarlane as being ripped straight from Rust. He backed up his claim with receipts and later revealed that the Delta Force team had ‘reached out to apologize’.

Blatant Theft

In a recent post on socials, Facepunch Studios’ COO, Alistair McFarlane, uploaded a screencap from a newly shared Delta Force trailer, which is several minutes long. He’d noticed that a brick of C4 and some circuitry seemed familiar. That’s because it was ripped from his own game, Rust.

The follow-up post from McFarlane showed exactly where that asset was, stating that it was ‘made full in-house’, and he even name-dropped the artist who created the explosive asset.

Several hours after posting the image and references, McFarlane responded with confirmation that Delta Force’s development team had reached out to apologize, and he stressed that the ‘matter is resolved.’

However, gamers in the comment section of these posts didn’t want Delta Force’s team to get off lightly, and tried suggesting that a mechanical spider seen in the opening of the trailer was a ‘Tick’ enemy from ARC Raiders, developed by Embark Studios.

It’s not, but it’s close.

The trailer uploaded by Delta Force was made to promote the game’s new season, which went live as the trailer dropped earlier today. Rust and Delta Force are two totally different games, but that’s besides the point.

Do you think TiMi Studio Group should be let off so lightly? Let me know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Battlefield 2042 is leaving PS Plus

item.title: 9 New Games Coming To Xbox Game Pass In Next Wave
item.content:encoded:
Xbox has announced that nine new games are coming to Xbox Game Pass as part of the second wave of titles for November 2025.

The new games join the service between November 19th and December 2ns, and include two day one offerings for players with either Xbox Game Pass Ultimate or PC Game Pass.

New Games Coming To Xbox Game Pass In November Wave 2

The first game joining the service is Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault on November 19th. One of the two day one games, Moonlighter 2 joins the service as a game preview offering on PC and is available for Xbox Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass subscribers.

Also being added on November 19th are Kulebra and the Souls of Limbo and Revenge of the Savage Planet. Both titles are being added to Game Pass Premium for Cloud, PC, and Console.

November 20th sees The Crew Motorfest and Monsters are Coming! Rock & Road available for Ultimate and PC members. That’s followed by Banishers: Ghost of New Eden and Kill It With Fire! 2 on November 25th for Ultimate, Premium, and PC.

The next day one release comes on December 1st when Marvel Cosmic Invasion lands on Cloud, Console, Handheld and PC for Ultimate and PC plans. And finally, on December 2nd, Lost Records: Bloom & Rage will be added for Ultimate, Premium and PC.

What do you think of the new games coming to Xbox Game Pass for Wave 2 in November and early December? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our full review of SpongeBob Squares: Titans of the Tide from the perspective of both a father and son. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Battlefield 2042 and 8 Other Games Are Leaving PlayStation Plus
item.content:encoded:
In December 2025, 9 games will leave PlayStation Plus, including big titles like Battlefield 2042, Forspoken, and more.

PlayStation Plus is a subscription service known for providing online multiplayer access and a library of games for players to try. The library differs for the tier players are subscribed to, with three tiers to choose from: Essential, Extra, and Deluxe. We already saw the PS Plus Game Catalog add nine new games this month, and now a similar number will be removed next month.

PlayStation Plus Will Be Removing 9 Games in December 2025

If you head over to the PS Plus page on your PlayStation 5 console, you will see that the Last Chance to Play section has been updated with several new titles. Battlefield 2042 is one of them, as expected, since we have seen all Battlefield titles leave the library every month since the release of Battlefield 6. Other big names are Forspoken, Grand Theft Auto III, and Sonic Frontiers, which I’m sure have many fans.

Interested readers can check out the complete list of games that will be leaving PlayStation Plus in December 2025 below:

  • Battlefield 2042
  • Grand Theft Auto III
  • Arcade Paradise VR
  • Sonic Frontiers
  • Forspoken
  • Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy’s Edge
  • Firefighting Simulator: The Squad
  • Surviving Mars
  • Star Trek: The Bridge

If you have never tried any of these games, I would definitely advise you to give some of them a shot before they are removed from the library. GTA III is a classic, Sonic Frontiers is a fun time, and Forspoken could be interesting to some as well. Each of their main stories requires around 20 or fewer gameplay hours and offers tons of side activities as well.

In other news, Red Dead Redemption will be coming to PlayStation Plus Game Catalog in December 2025. Additionally, PS Plus users can download GTA 5 this month. What are your thoughts on the nine games that are leaving PlayStation Plus in December? Will you be playing any of them before they are removed? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the patch notes for Stalker 2’s Expedition update. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
